intro: Eriogonum havardii, commonly known as Havard's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing bright yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert environments. Eriogonum havardii is well adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystem.
